alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 05 at 10:00PM EST until February 07 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... The Cumberland River at Williamsburg, affecting Whitley County. For the Cumberland River...including Williamsburg...elevated river levels are occurring. ...A FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...High water caused by excessive rainfall persists. * WHERE...The advisory is for the Cumberland River near Williamsburg. * WHEN...The advisory is in effect until late Sunday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 7.0 feet ny Thursday morning. - Action stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay updated on further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued 10 AM Sunday.
